version_name: 4.3:-----------------------Massive update: Totally rebuilt formulas & charts with habit calendar and animations

version_description:
Lots of improvements for the new year:
- Guided setup: Simplified custom tracker setup.
- Added: Log from notifications with iOS 10!
- Added: Color Blind Friendly Mode.
- Added: A few helpful tutorial tips.
- Improved: When to Log (Weekdays by default).
- Fixed: Average chart and Dashboard bar issues.
- Fixed: Slow/locking issue with lots of trackers.

Up next: Adding tabs for the most popular feature requests, Today & Reports! Can't wait for you to see that update. :)

We really appreciate all the 5-star reviews, and good luck with all your goals & habits!

Make strides every day,
Kyle, Brian, Jason, Tim & Jonathan

Here's a nice update to kick off 2017:
- Target Daily Goal now considers weekdays
- Export all your data in one CSV (Plus)
- Improved long-tap tracker screen
- 1Password to make logging in easier
- Fixed 14 bugs and prepared for v5.2*

*Up next: We've been rebuilding our entire backend sync service for months, and we're almost ready to release it. This will make the app feel significantly faster, with more reliable sync and full support for emojis & international keyboards, and fix several rare issues some users have seen. That'll be v6.0.

In the next update, while we wrap up the sync improvements, we're giving the interface some nice upgrades we think you'll like. :)

We really appreciate all the 5-star reviews, and good luck with all your goals & habits!

Make strides every day,
Kyle, Brian, Jason, Tim & Jonathan

With the new Today Widget and Daily Goals tab, we've gotten a ton of feedback that the Today view should be the primary view in the app, so we're doing that in this update. It automatically filters what you have scheduled to log today, moves things down when they're taken care of so you can focus, and makes it easy to look at past days' logs, so it's a lot better for logging than the Dashboard. Since logging is by far the most common action, we want to make that the view with the best logging experience is the default view.

The Dashboard is best for viewing your current progress on all your trackers, regardless of when they're due to be logged, so it's a great way to check on how you're doing on everything in one place. If you'd still prefer to log from the Dashboard, the app will keep you on that tab unless it goes out of memory because it hasn't been opened in a while, in which case tapping the tab will get you back to the Dashboard.

We also added a automatic smart filter to the Today view for weekly and monthly habits so they won't show on their When to Log days if their Goal is already met for the week/month. For example, you could set your Work Out habit to be logged Every Day, with a Goal of 5 times per week, and if you've worked out every day then the last two days of the week it won't show up on the Daily Goals view, which will save you a step.

The widget was also improved and we fixed a few bugs like the Widget showing blank for some people, and the Week Starts On & Alert Sound settings reverting in some cases.

Best of luck with all your goals & habits!
Kyle, Brian, Jason, Tim & Jonathan

Added the long-awaited Progress Reports feature! The Dashboard has evolved into Reports, which adds Average Progress and tabs for Trends (weekly, monthly & yearly), Calendar (all-time) and Rankings by Streak.

Note: We removed the old Dashboard status icons. We kept them for more than a year after the Today view was added as the primary way to log, but we had to remove them for the new Reports view. It cleans up the interface quite a bit, giving more room for your tracker names and progress bars. The majority of trackers are daily so it's easy to tell if they've been logged for the day, but if you need to check you can either (a) tap the Today tab to see what's due, or (b) use the Due Today filter at the top of the Reports view to focus on what's due. Tip: You can still swipe to log from the Reports view.

Also, every report can be filtered by tag so you can see how you're doing on your health habits, money goals, etc. It's a really powerful way to get deeper insights. Enjoy!
